techmeme.title: An ex-Reality Labs manager says Meta asked the unit to cut spending by ~20% between 2024-2026; Meta plans two Quest 4 versions in 2026 and Quest Pro 2 in 2027 (The Information)
Intel veteran Lisa Spelman plans to become CEO of Cornelis, a networking startup spun off from Intel in 2020, on August 15; Spelman worked at Intel for 20 years (Jane Lanhee Lee/Bloomberg)
Block's Cash App plans to close its UK operations on September 15, after launching in 2018, as the company "deprioritizes global expansion" to focus on the US (Bloomberg)
Nvidia and Mistral release Mistral NeMo, a 12B-parameter language model with a 128K-token context window, available under the Apache 2.0 open-source license (Michael Nuñez/VentureBeat)
Adobe: US shoppers spent $14.2B during Amazon's 48-hour Prime Day sale, up 11% YoY and in line with estimates; Numerator: the average household spent about $152 (Spencer Soper/Bloomberg)
